_comment: Diagnostic Definition Schema — save as [slug].json in data/2-Domaines/diagnostics/
name: Lead Qualifier
purpose: Determine if a prospect is ready for a proposal or needs nurture first

delivery.intro_message: I'm going to ask you a few questions to understand where you are right now. No right answers — just where things actually stand. Takes about 8 minutes.
delivery.completion_message: All done. Let me put your results together.

dimensions.name: Problem Clarity
dimensions.description: How clearly the prospect has defined the problem they need solved

questions.text: How would you describe the problem you're trying to solve right now?

options.label: I have a general sense something isn't working but can't fully articulate it
I know what the problem is but I'm not sure it's the right priority
I can describe the problem clearly — I just need help solving it
I've already diagnosed the root cause and I know what a solution looks like

questions.text: How long has this problem been affecting your business?

options.label: I'm not sure it's actually a problem yet — still figuring that out
It's come up recently, within the last few months
It's been a recurring issue for 6–12 months
It's been a known issue for over a year and we've lived with the cost of it

dimensions.name: Pain Acuity
dimensions.description: How much the problem is costing them and how urgent solving it feels

questions.text: What happens if this problem isn't solved in the next 6 months?

options.label: Probably not much — it's more of an irritation than a crisis
Things stay suboptimal — we lose time or money but the business survives
Growth stalls or a specific opportunity closes that I don't want to miss
The business hits a real ceiling or I lose something I can't get back

questions.text: How much is this problem costing you right now?

options.label: I haven't quantified it — it's more of a nagging feeling
Some cost, but I haven't attached a number to it
I have a rough estimate — it's significant enough to justify solving
I know exactly what it costs — I've done the math and it's substantial

questions.text: How high is solving this on your priority list right now?

options.label: It's on the backlog — we have more pressing things to handle first
It's important but not the top priority this quarter
It's a top-3 priority for my business this quarter
It's the #1 thing I need to solve right now — everything else depends on it

dimensions.name: Decision Readiness
dimensions.description: Whether the right stakeholders are involved and motivated to act

questions.text: Who else needs to be involved in a decision to work together?

options.label: Several people — I'm not the decision-maker, just exploring
One other person, but I'm not sure they're aligned on this priority yet
One other person who's already aware and supportive
I'm the decision-maker — no one else needs to approve

questions.text: Where are you in evaluating solutions?

options.label: Just starting to look — not sure what I need yet
Comparing different approaches, no timeline to decide
Narrowing down — looking to decide in the next 4–6 weeks
Ready to move — looking for the right partner with a timeline in mind

dimensions.name: Budget Reality
dimensions.description: Whether budget exists and is allocated for this

questions.text: How is budget for this handled in your business?

options.label: No budget allocated — this would be new spend I'd need to justify
Budget exists in theory but hasn't been formally approved
Budget is set aside and approved for the right solution
Budget is ready — I'm looking to commit when I find the right fit

low.headline: Not yet ready
low.insight: Based on where you are right now, jumping into a formal engagement would be premature — not because the problem isn't real, but because a few foundational things need to fall into place first. The work would be harder and slower than it needs to be.
low.priority_action: Get clear on what success looks like and get the right stakeholder aligned before evaluating solutions. That conversation will make everything downstream easier.
low.cta_text: I put together a short guide on how to build that internal case →

medium.headline: Worth a conversation
medium.insight: You have a real problem and real motivation to solve it. What's missing is full readiness to move — whether that's timeline clarity, stakeholder alignment, or budget confirmation. A short conversation would help us figure out whether now is the right moment or what would make it so.
medium.priority_action: Have a 30-minute conversation to assess fit and timing. No commitment — just whether the pieces are in place to make this worthwhile for both of us.

high.headline: Ready to move
high.insight: You've done the hard work of defining the problem, securing alignment, and getting serious about solving it. That puts you in a small minority of people who are actually ready to make progress — not just thinking about it.
high.priority_action: Let's look at your specific situation and build out what a proposal would look like. You're ready; the next step is making sure the fit and scope are right.

problem_clarity.low_feedback: The problem isn't fully defined yet — which means solutions will feel vague too. Getting precise on the root cause is the highest-leverage first step.
problem_clarity.high_feedback: Clear problem definition. You know what you're solving for, which makes everything else faster.

pain_acuity.low_feedback: The urgency isn't there yet. This will likely stay on the backlog until something forces it to the top.
pain_acuity.high_feedback: Real urgency and clear cost awareness. You're not exploring — you're solving.

decision_readiness.low_feedback: The decision process isn't clear yet. There are stakeholders or approval steps that haven't been navigated.
decision_readiness.high_feedback: You have the authority and motivation to move. No internal gatekeepers to work around.

budget_reality.low_feedback: Budget isn't in place yet — which means any proposal would require internal justification work first.
budget_reality.high_feedback: Budget is allocated. The financial side won't be the obstacle.

tally_export.form_description: 8 minutes. Honest answers. A clear picture of where things stand.
